page.title: 20SCHOOL ANECDOTES
page.content: Mr. Wilcox delighted the children with reminiscences of his school days. He was often to be found when mischief was afoot and he recalled the time when he was punished for shooting his catapult in the classroom. When later in the week he was asked to burn the rubbish, he retrieved his catapult from the basket and hid it in a tree, to be recovered when the headmaster was on holiday. On another occasion he was sent to the garage to buy a set of plugs for the headmaster's car. The local garage could not supply them and so he was sent on his bicycle to the garage at Great Witley.Failing again to obtain the plugs,the headmaster sent him on the bus to Worcester to buy them.He bought the plugs,and while waiting for the bus to go home he ate thirteen Chelsea buns by the riverside And all this happened in school time!
